Legal_Issue: Whether Genpharm's allegations of invalidity and non-infringement are justified
Evidence_Assessment: Analysis of prior art, product formulation, inventive step, expert opinions
Burden_of_Proof: On Genpharm to substantiate invalidity or non-infringement
Credibility_Factor: Court assessed credibility of evidence from both parties
Legal_Rule: Generic producer must provide detailed statement on legal and factual basis for invalidity or non-infringement claims
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness in regulatory context
Review_Standard: Substantive review of allegations under regulatory framework
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Fair opportunity to present evidence and arguments
Key_Evidence_Considered: Patents '693, '377, '668, '762', expert testimony, prior art, product data
Court_Result: Order prohibiting NOC issuance to Genpharm until patent expiry
Defendant_Response: Genpharm alleged invalidity and non-infringement based on prior art and formulation
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, expert opinion, technical data
Remedy_Requested: Order to prohibit Minister from issuing NOC
Decision_Authority: Federal Court or relevant regulatory court
Legal_Provision: Sections under Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of sufficient substantiation by Genpharm
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Prohibition of NOC pending patent expiry
